AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM, Charge

Includes:
1. Performing tests per Service Manual instructions
2. Perform Air Conditioning Performance Test
3. Perform refrigerant identification test, using special tool, prior to recovering refrigerant
4. Recover, replenish refrigerant oil, evacuate and charge A/C system
5. Check for leaks using a leak detector

Notes:
1. Extended Leak Test for use only when initial leak test is inconclusive and system is empty. Includes adding partial/full charge, including dye, or pressure test system with nitrogen

Component Qualifier Code Applies To Hours
A19-3240 Models, ALL 1.3

Addon If Required   Code Applies To Hours
PERFORM EXTENDED REFRIGERANT LEAK TEST,        
Includes add partial or full charge, w/dye, and retest A19-3240-1 Models, ALL 0.5
PERFORM EXTENDED REFRIGERANT LEAK TEST,        
Includes pressure test system with nitrogen A19-3240-2 Models, ALL 0.5
PERFORM FREON COMPRESSOR TEST,        
A19-3240-3 Models, ALL 0.3

AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM, Purge and Charge

Includes:
1. Performance tests as outlined in Service manual
2. Check for leaks using a leak detector
3. R&R pressure transducer
4. R&R Refrigerant lines
5. R&R or replace accumulator or receiver dryer
6. R&R Freon Compressor Clutch Cycle Orifice Tube (CCOT) if applicable
7. R&R or replace thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) if applicable
8. R&R freon compressor and belt, recalculate system oil charge
9. R&R HVAC thermistor(s) with complete freon loss or internal compressor failure
10. Evacuate and charge A/C system

Notes:
1. Purging is performed when the part being replaced has significant damage and caused a sudden loss of freon
2. With no freon in the system, it is not necessary to identify refrigerant, recover A/C system, or conduct the initial A/C performance test

Component Qualifier Code Applies To Hours
A19-3220 Models, ALL 2.2

FREON COMPRESSOR, Replace

Includes:
1. Performing tests per Service Manual instructions
2. Remove and replace component and reinstall all related parts
3. Perform compressor test per manual instructions with internal failure
4. Remove and reinstall drive belt and adjust
5. Perform refrigerant identification test, using special tool, prior to recovering refrigerant
6. Recover, replenish refrigerant oil, evacuate and charge A/C system
7. R&R pressure transducer switch with complete freon loss or internal compressor failure
8. Flush and purge A/C system components with internal compressor failure, purge with complete freon loss.
9. R&R HVAC thermistor(s) with complete freon loss or internal compressor failure
10. R&R Freon Compressor Clutch Cycle Orifice Tube (CCOT) if applicable
11. R&R or replace thermostatic expansion valve (TXV) if applicable
12. R&R or replace accumulator or receiver dryer with complete freon loss or internal compressor failure
13. Check for leaks using a leak detector

Notes:
1. Clutch or Minor Leak failure includes charge A/C, Internal failure includes flush, purge and charge A/C

Component Qualifier Code Applies To Hours
Sanden Compessor Internal Failure Only A19-3100 Other Models 3.2
Sanden Compessor Clutch or Front Seal Failure A19-3101 Other Models 1.8
Visteon Compressor Internal Failure Only A19-3102 CF 500/600 3.3
Visteon Compressor Clutch or Front Seal Failure A19-3103 CF 500/600 2.3

Addon If Required   Code Applies To Hours
FREON CONDENSER, Replace        
A19-3100-1 Models, ALL 0.2

FREON COMPRESSOR BELT, Replace

Includes:
1. Remove and replace component and reinstall all related parts

Component Qualifier Code Applies To Hours
International Engines A19-3890 Models, ALL 0.3
Additional Belt A19-3891 Models, ALL 0.1

Big Bore Engines A19-3892 8600 0.4
